connectionCard_headlineMissing.message: Connect tldw Assistant to your server

connectionCard_descriptionMissing.message: tldw server is an optional backend that runs on your own machine or server. It powers chat history, Knowledge search, and media processing. You can explore the extension first, then connect your own server when you’re ready.

connectionCard_descriptionSearching.message: We’re checking {{host}} to see if your tldw server is reachable. This can take a few seconds the first time or after the server restarts.

connectionCard_descriptionConnected.message: Connected to your tldw server at {{host}}. You can start chatting, search knowledge, review media, and use other tools from the header.

connectionCard_descriptionConnectedList_.message: Use RAG with your own documents

connectionCard_descriptionError.message: We couldn’t reach your tldw server at {{host}}. Check that the server is running, the URL matches your tldw_server, and your browser is allowed to reach it. Use Diagnostics for detailed errors and next steps.

connectionCard_tipQuickIngest.message: Tip: Need ingest help while you’re offline?

connectionCard_quickIngestHint.message: When your server is offline, Quick Ingest works as a staging area. You can queue URLs and files now and process them once you reconnect.

connectionCard_sidepanelOpenSettingsHint.message: Settings open in a new browser tab so you can configure your tldw server.

connectionCard_quickIngestInlineHint.message: Quick Ingest can queue URLs and files while your server is offline so you can process them once you reconnect.

header_moreMenu_tooltip.message: Advanced tools like sidebar, repository, and debug options

header_serverBackedTooltip.message: Messages in this chat are also saved on your tldw server.

header_connectionCard.connectedCaption.message: Chat and tools are now available in Options and the sidepanel.

header_quickIngestQueuedAria.message: {{label}} — {{count}} items queued — click to review and process

promptStudio_subtitle.message: Manage Prompt Studio projects, prompts, executions, test cases, and evaluations.

promptStudio_capabilityErrorBody.message: Check server connectivity or disable this section until the Prompt Studio APIs are available.

promptStudio_offline.message: Connect to your server to use Prompt Studio

promptStudio_workspaceHint.message: Create or open a project to edit prompts.

promptStudio_executePlaceholder.message: Execution form coming soon. Use this pane to run single inputs against a prompt via /prompt-studio/prompts/execute.

promptStudio_testsHint.message: List/create test cases, run evaluations, poll status.

promptStudio_testsPlaceholder.message: Scaffolding placeholder: hook up test case CRUD, evaluation create/list/detail, and async polling in this section.

promptStudio_unavailable.message: Prompt Studio is not enabled on this server.

promptStudio_unavailableBody.message: When available, you will see projects, prompt history, execute flows, and evaluations here.

validationSelectModel.message: Please select a model to continue

deleteHistoryConfirmation.message: Are you sure you want to delete this history?

promptSearch_overwriteLocalPlaceholder.message: Select a local prompt to overwrite

quickIngest_subtitle.message: Enter one or more URLs. Force type per row if needed.

quickIngest_offlineDescription.message: You can queue URLs and files here and inspect fields, but ingestion will not run until your tldw server is online. Reconnect to process pending items.

quickIngest_unconfiguredDescription.message: You can queue URLs and files now; ingestion will run after you configure a server URL and API key under Settings → tldw server.

quickIngest_offlineBypassDescription.message: Items are staged here and will process once you disable offline mode or re-enable live server checks.

quickIngest_checkingDescription.message: We’re checking your tldw server before running ingest. You can start queuing items while we confirm reachability.

quickIngest_storeRemoteAria.message: Store ingest results on your tldw server

quickIngest_storeRemoteHelp.message: Uploads to your tldw server for indexing.

quickIngest_processOnlyHelp.message: Process only and keep results local (download JSON).

quickIngest_storageServerDescription.message: Stored on your tldw server (recommended for RAG and shared workspaces).

quickIngest_storageLocalDescription.message: Kept in this browser only; no data written to your server.

quickIngest_reviewBeforeStorageHint.message: Process now, then edit drafts locally before committing to your server.

quickIngest_reviewWarningBody.message: Drafts are saved in this browser and may include sensitive data. You can clear drafts from the Content Review page at any time.

quickIngest_reviewWarningBodySecondary.message: Review mode keeps content client-side until you commit it to your server.

quickIngest_reviewNavigationFailed.message: Couldn't open Content Review. Please try again.

quickIngest_reviewStorageCapWarning_one.message: {{count}} file exceeds the local draft cap ({{cap}}). Attach sources before committing audio/video.

quickIngest_reviewStorageCapWarning_othe.message: {{count}} files exceed the local draft cap ({{cap}}). Attach sources before committing audio/video.

quickIngest_audioDiarizationHelp.message: Turn on to separate speakers in transcripts.

quickIngest_quickIngest_ocrHelp.message: OCR helps extract text from scanned PDFs or images.

quickIngest_queueOnlyOfflineAria.message: Offline — queue items to process later

quickIngest_queueOnlyUnconfiguredAria.message: Server not configured — queue items to process after you configure a server.

quickIngest_queueOnlyOfflineBypassAria.message: Offline mode enabled — queue items to process after you disable offline mode.

quickIngest_offlineQueueToast.message: Offline mode: items are queued here until your server is back online.

quickIngest_unconfiguredQueueToast.message: Server not configured: items are staged here and will not run until you configure a server under Settings → tldw server.

quickIngest_offlineBypassQueueToast.message: Offline mode enabled: items are staged here and will process once you disable offline mode.

quickIngest_offlineFooter.message: Can’t reach your server. Items are staged here and will process once your server reconnects.

quickIngest_unconfiguredFooter.message: Can’t reach your server. Items are staged here and will process after you configure a server URL and API key under Settings → tldw server.

quickIngest_offlineBypassFooter.message: Can’t reach your server. Items are staged here and will process once you disable offline mode.

quickIngest_advancedEmpty.message: No advanced options detected — try reloading the spec.

quickIngest_pendingUnconfigured.message: Pending — will run after you configure a server.

quickIngest_pendingOfflineBypass.message: Pending — will run when offline mode is disabled.

quickIngest_readyToast.message: Server back online — ready to process {{count}} queued items.

quickIngest_errorSummary.message: We couldn’t process ingest items right now.

quickIngest_errorHint.message: Try again after checking your tldw server. Health & diagnostics can help troubleshoot ingest issues.

quickIngest_checkHealthLink.message: Check server health in Health & diagnostics

quickIngest_healthAriaHint.message: Recent runs failed — open Health & diagnostics from the header for more details.

quickIngest_noFailedUrlToRetry.message: No failed URL items to retry.

quickIngest_tipsHybrid.message: Hybrid input: drop files or paste URLs (comma/newline separated) to build the queue.

quickIngest_tipsPerType.message: Per-type settings (Audio/PDF/Video) apply to all items of that type.

quickIngest_tipsInspector.message: Use the Inspector to see status, type, and quick checks before ingesting.

quickIngest_supportedFormats.message: Supported: docs, PDFs, audio, video, and web URLs.

quickIngest_dragAndDropHint.message: Docs, PDFs, audio, and video are all welcome.

quickIngest_pasteUrlsHint.message: Separate with commas or new lines

quickIngest_authRequiredHint.message: Authentication-required pages may need cookies set in Advanced.

quickIngest_queueDescription.message: Staged items appear here. Click a row to open the Inspector; badges show defaults, custom edits, or items needing attention.

quickIngest_emptyQueue.message: No items queued yet. Drop files or add URLs to start.

quickIngest_audioSettingsTitle.message: These audio settings apply to every audio item in this run.

quickIngest_audioSettingsHint.message: These settings apply to every audio item in this run.

quickIngest_documentSettingsTitle.message: These document settings apply to every document/PDF in this run.

quickIngest_documentSettingsHint.message: Applies to all document/PDF items in this batch.

quickIngest_videoSettingsTitle.message: These video settings apply to every video in this run.

quickIngest_videoSettingsHint.message: Applies to all video items in this batch.

quickIngest_inspectorIntroItem1.message: Click a queued item to see its detected type, status, and warnings.

quickIngest_inspectorIntroItem2.message: Use per-type controls on the main panel to set defaults; any per-row override marks it Custom.

quickIngest_inspectorIntroItem3.message: For auth-required URLs, add cookies/headers in Advanced before ingesting.

quickIngest_inspectorIntroDismissed.message: Intro dismissed. Reset anytime with “Reset Inspector Intro.”

quickIngest_inspectorRowEditHint.message: Editing the URL or forcing a type marks this item as Custom.

quickIngest_inspectorFileHint.message: File settings follow the per-type controls on the main panel.

quickIngest_inspectorAdvancedHint.message: Use Advanced options to set cookies/auth if required. Errors or warnings appear on each row.

quickIngest_inspectorEmpty.message: Select a queued item to view details.

quickIngest_specTooltipFallback.message: No spec detected; using fallback fields

quickIngest_specReloadedToastDiff.message: Advanced spec reloaded from server (fields added: {{added}}, removed: {{removed}})

quickIngest_specFallbackWarning.message: Using bundled media.add schema fallback (v{{version}}); please verify against your tldw_server /openapi.json if fields look outdated.

quickIngest_preferServerAria.message: Advanced options – prefer server OpenAPI spec

quickIngest_resetAdvancedAria.message: Reset advanced options and UI state

quickIngest_confirmResetContent.message: Reset all advanced options and UI state?

quickIngest_processingComplete.message: Processing complete. Use "Download JSON" below to save results locally.

quickIngest_summarySomeFailed.message: Quick ingest completed with some errors.

notesSearch_tagsHelp.message: Keywords help you find this note using the keyword filter on the left.

notesEmpty_connectDescription.message: To use Notes, first connect to your tldw server.

notesEmpty_connectExample1.message: Open Settings → tldw server to add your server URL.

notesEmpty_connectExample2.message: Use Diagnostics if your server is running but not reachable.

notesEmpty_demoDescription.message: This demo shows how Notes can organize your insights. Connect your own server later to create and save real notes.

notesEmpty_demoExample1.message: See how note titles, previews, and timestamps appear in the list.

notesEmpty_demoExample2.message: When you connect, you’ll be able to create notes from meetings, reviews, and more.

notesEmpty_demoExample3.message: Use Notes alongside Media and Review to keep track of your findings.

notesEmpty_demoSample1Preview.message: Decisions, blockers, and follow-ups from a recent team sync.

notesEmpty_demoSample2Preview.message: Key insights pulled from a long article or paper.

notesEmpty_demoSample3Preview.message: Summary of a customer call with next steps and owners.

notesEmpty_description.message: Capture and organize free-form notes connected to your tldw insights.

notesEmpty_exampleCreate.message: Create a new note for a recent meeting or transcript.

notesEmpty_exampleLink.message: Save review outputs into Notes so you can revisit them later.

worldBooksEmpty_demoTitle.message: Explore World Books in demo mode

worldBooksEmpty_demoDescription.message: This demo shows how World Books can organize structured knowledge about your worlds, settings, or products.

worldBooksEmpty_demoExample1.message: See example books like a fantasy setting, product glossary, or campaign notes.

worldBooksEmpty_demoExample2.message: When you connect, you’ll be able to create world books that tldw can use while chatting.

worldBooksEmpty_connectDescription.message: To use World Books, first connect to your tldw server so world knowledge can be saved and retrieved.

worldBooksEmpty_connectExample1.message: Open Settings → tldw server to add your server URL.

worldBooksEmpty_connectExample2.message: Use Diagnostics if your server is running but not reachable.

worldBooksEmpty_headerDescription.message: Create and manage structured knowledge bases that characters and chats can reference.

worldBooksEmpty_offlineDescription.message: Connect to your tldw server from the main settings page to view and edit World Books.

dictionariesEmpty_demoTitle.message: Explore Chat dictionaries in demo mode

dictionariesEmpty_demoDescription.message: This demo shows how Chat dictionaries can normalize names, acronyms, and terms before they reach the model.

dictionariesEmpty_demoExample1.message: See example dictionaries for product names, project codenames, or company jargon.

dictionariesEmpty_demoExample2.message: When you connect, you’ll be able to activate dictionaries across all chats.

dictionariesEmpty_connectDescription.message: To use Chat dictionaries, first connect to your tldw server so substitutions can be stored.

dictionariesEmpty_connectExample1.message: Open Settings → tldw server to add your server URL.

dictionariesEmpty_connectExample2.message: Use Diagnostics if your server is running but not reachable.

dictionariesEmpty_headerDescription.message: Define reusable substitutions so tldw understands your organization’s names, acronyms, and terminology.

dictionariesEmpty_offlineDescription.message: Connect to your tldw server from the main settings page to view and edit Chat dictionaries.

charactersEmpty_demoDescription.message: This demo shows how Characters encapsulate a persona and system prompt that you can chat with.

charactersEmpty_demoExample1.message: See example characters like a writing coach, lore expert, or coding assistant.

charactersEmpty_demoExample2.message: When you connect, you’ll be able to create characters that appear in the chat header and selection.

charactersEmpty_connectDescription.message: To use Characters, first connect to your tldw server so character definitions can be stored.

charactersEmpty_connectExample1.message: Open Settings → tldw server to add your server URL.

charactersEmpty_connectExample2.message: Use Diagnostics if your server is running but not reachable.

charactersEmpty_headerDescription.message: Create reusable characters you can pick from the chat header and reuse across conversations.

charactersEmpty_headerSelectHint.message: Create a character to reuse their persona across chats. Use “New character” to get started.

charactersEmpty_offlineTitle.message: Characters API not available on this server

charactersEmpty_offlineExample1.message: Open Diagnostics to confirm your server version and available APIs for Characters.

charactersEmpty_offlineExample2.message: If you upgrade your server, reload the extension and return to Characters.

characters_fetchErrorBody.message: Check your connection or server health, then try again.

characters_noMatches.message: No characters match your search yet.

promptInsert_useInChatTooltip.message: Open chat and insert this prompt into the composer.

promptInsert_confirmDescription.message: Your message already has text. Do you want to overwrite it with this prompt or append the prompt below it?

flashcards_emptyConnectDescription.message: To review or generate flashcards, first connect to your tldw server.

flashcards_emptyConnectExample1.message: Go to Settings → tldw server to add your server URL.

flashcards_emptyConnectExample2.message: Once connected, review due cards or create new decks from your notes and media.

flashcards_demoDescription.message: This demo shows how Flashcards can turn your content into spaced‑repetition cards. Connect your own server later to generate and review cards from your own notes and media.

flashcards_demoExample1.message: See how decks, cards, and tags are organized across Review and Manage tabs.

flashcards_demoExample2.message: When you connect, you’ll be able to generate cards from lectures, meetings, or notes and review them on a schedule.

flashcards_demoExample3.message: Use Flashcards together with Notes and Media to keep important ideas fresh.

flashcards_demoSample1Summary.message: 10 cards · Great for testing spacing and ratings.

flashcards_demoSample2Summary.message: 8 cards · Names, acronyms, and key definitions.

flashcards_demoSample3Summary.message: 6 cards · Example action items to review.

flashcards_offlineTitle.message: Flashcards API not available on this server

flashcards_offlineDescription.message: This tldw server does not advertise the Flashcards endpoints. Upgrade your server to a version that includes /api/v1/flashcards… to use this workspace.

flashcards_offlineExample1.message: Check Health & diagnostics to confirm your server version and available APIs.

flashcards_offlineExample2.message: After upgrading, reload the extension and return to Flashcards.

flashcards_importHelp.message: Paste TSV/CSV lines: Deck, Front, Back, Tags, Notes

flashcards_missingVersion.message: Missing version; reload and try again

flashcards_bulkMoveSelectDeck.message: Select a target deck before moving cards.

flashcards_ratingHardHelp.message: I barely remembered; it felt difficult.

flashcards_ratingGoodHelp.message: I remembered with a bit of effort.

flashcards_ratingEasyHelp.message: I recalled it quickly and confidently.

flashcards_noDueDescription.message: You’re all caught up. Create new cards or import an existing deck to start reviewing.

flashcards_createDescription.message: Use the front for the question and the back for the answer. You can group cards into decks and add tags for faster search.

flashcards_createDescriptionSimple.message: Fill in the front (question) and back (answer). Markdown and LaTeX are supported.

flashcards_modelTypeHelp.message: Basic shows a question on the front and answer on the back. Reverse also creates the opposite card. Cloze hides parts of the text using {{...}}.

flashcards_reverseHelp.message: Also create a card where the back becomes the question.

flashcards_isClozeHelp.message: Use for fill‑in‑the‑blank cards. Wrap hidden text in {{...}} on the front.

flashcards_selectionHelp.message: “Select all across results” applies actions to every card that matches your filters, not just this page.

flashcards_noCardsDescription.message: Create cards from your notes and media, or import an existing deck.

flashcards_mappingPreview.message: Preview of the first few mapped rows:

flashcards_exportHelp.message: Filter by deck, tag, or search, then export as CSV/TSV for spreadsheets or Anki (.apkg) for Anki clients.

contentReview_emptyDescription.message: No drafts yet. Use Quick Ingest with Review before saving to create drafts.

contentReview_reviewBeforeStorageHint.message: Process now, then edit drafts locally before committing to your server.

contentReview_reviewWarningBody.message: Drafts are saved in this browser and may include sensitive data. You can clear drafts from the Content Review page at any time.

contentReview_reviewWarningBodySecondary.message: Review mode keeps content client-side until you commit it to your server.

contentReview_reviewStorageCapWarning_on.message: {{count}} file exceeds the local draft cap ({{cap}}). Attach sources before committing audio/video.

contentReview_reviewStorageCapWarning_ot.message: {{count}} files exceed the local draft cap ({{cap}}). Attach sources before committing audio/video.

contentReview_selectDraft.message: Select a draft to begin reviewing.

contentReview_resetBody.message: This will restore the original content for this draft.

contentReview_aiHint.message: Sends draft content to your server for AI processing.

contentReview_aiConsentBody.message: This will send the draft content to your tldw server for AI processing. Drafts stay local until you commit.

contentReview_detectSectionsBody.message: This will replace existing sections and reset your selections.

contentReview_templates_transcript_clean.message: Normalize punctuation and casing while preserving line structure.

contentReview_templates_speaker_turns_de.message: Ensure each speaker turn is on its own line with clear labels.

contentReview_templates_chapter_headings.message: Insert Markdown headings to group topics without removing content.

contentReview_missingSourceBody.message: Attach the original file to commit this draft.

contentReview_commitDisabled.message: Attach the original audio/video file before committing.

contentReview_discardBody.message: This draft will be marked as discarded and removed from review.

contentReview_commitAllBody.message: Only drafts marked as reviewed will be committed.

contentReview_storageCapWarning.message: This file exceeds the local draft cap ({{cap}}).

contentReview_clearBody.message: This removes all local content review drafts and assets.

upload_fileTooLargeDescription.message: File size must be less than 10MB

upload_uploadFailedDescription.message: Failed to upload file. Please try again.

quickChatHelper_emptyState.message: Start a quick side chat to keep your main thread clean.

quickChatHelper_popOutDisabled.message: Pop-out is disabled when there are no messages. Start a conversation first.

quickChatHelper_noModelWarning.message: Please select a model in the main chat first.

quiz_optionsRequired.message: Please provide at least two options.

quiz_answerAll.message: Please answer all questions before submitting.

dictionariesTools_validateHelp.message: Check schema, regex safety, and template syntax for this dictionary.

dictionariesTools_validateEmpty.message: Add at least one entry to validate.

dictionariesTools_previewHelp.message: Test how this dictionary rewrites sample text.

dictionariesTools_sampleTextPlaceholder.message: Paste text to preview dictionary substitutions.
